snippet: Nate Silver and his ilk were vilified by pundits who accused the number crunchers of bias. But, after correctly predicting the shape of Obama's victory, they're vindicated.
abstract: Nate Silver and his ilk were vilified by pundits who accused the number crunchers of bias. But, after correctly predicting the shape of Obama's victory, they're vindicated.

headline.main: The Rise of the Quants in Political Prognostication
